qas.question: What percentage of the student body of BYU has some proficiency in a second language?
What can be attributed to BYU's high percentage of second language proficient students?

answers.text: 45 percent of the student body at BYU has been missionaries for LDS Church

qas.question: How many languages are offered as courses at BYU?
What designation does BYU's Russian language program hold?

answers.text: largest of their kind in the nation

qas.question: Who chose BYU as the location of the national Middle East Language Resource Center?
What have 60% of the student body done for the LDS Church?
Over one-third of the student body has some proficiency in what?
What are three quarters of students enrolled in during any given semester?

context: <a0_0>Over three quarters<a0_0/> of the student body has some proficiency in <b6_0>a second language<b6_0/> (numbering 107 languages in total). This is partially due to the fact that <a1_0>45 percent of the student body at BYU has <b5_0>been missionaries<b5_0/> for LDS Church<a1_0/>, and many of them learned a foreign language as part of their mission assignment. During any given semester, about one-third of the student body is enrolled in <b7_0><b8_0>foreign language classes<b8_0/><b7_0/>, a rate nearly four times the national average. BYU offers courses in <a2_0>over 60<a2_0/> different languages, many with advanced courses that are seldom offered elsewhere. Several of its language programs are the <a3_0>largest of their kind in the nation<a3_0/>, the Russian program being one example. The university was selected by the <a4_0>United States Department of Education<a4_0/> as the location of the national Middle East Language Resource Center, making the school a hub for experts on that region. It was also selected as a Center for International Business Education Research, a function of which is to train business employees in international languages and relations.
